types1:Item.types1:Name: Reltio-1
types1:Item.types1:Description: This connector will be used to interact with Reltio REST APIs

businessConnector.name: Reltio-1
businessConnector.description: This connector will be used to interact with Reltio REST APIs

connectionAttribute.description: A username of the end user registered in the Reltio database.
connectionAttribute.name: username

connectionAttribute.description: A password of the end user registered in the Reltio database.
connectionAttribute.name: password

connectionAttribute.description: Type of access token request. The value is: password
connectionAttribute.name: grant_type

parameter.description: The access token permits the customer to request protected information by calling other Reltio APIs
parameter.name: accessToken

action.label: GetEntity
action.name: GetEntity
action.description: Returns an entity object (full or partial) by URI from tenant. This operation returns an entity object (full or partial) by URI from the tenant.

parameter.description: Comma-separated list of properties from entity structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return partial entity object
parameter.name: select

parameter.description: Returns an object as it was in the Reltio system at some point in time (timestamp in ms).
parameter.name: time

parameter.description: Comma-separated list of different options which affect entity's JSON content in the response. Available options: sendHidden: disabled by default, the entity's JSON contains hidden attributes if this option is enabled. ovOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=true flag. nonOvOnly: return only attribute values that have the ov=false flag. If you have a nested or reference attribute value, where ov=true, but sub-attributes, where ov=false, then these sub-attributes will not appear in the response.
parameter.name: options

parameter.description: Specify true to check that all crosswalks for the required entity are unique.
parameter.name: mergeDuplicateCrosswalks

parameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of values listed in attributes. This restriction is intended for the UI convenience in cases where there are very long lists of values in some attributes.
parameter.name: defaultMaxValues

parameter.description: Entity Id
parameter.name: entityId

action.label: GetAccessToken
action.name: GetAccessToken
action.description: To get he access token which which is required to make Reltio API Calls

action.label: EntitySearch
action.name: EntitySearch
action.description: This operation performs search for entities by attribute values, tags, type, and roles

parameter.description: Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*)
parameter.name: filter

parameter.description: Comma-separated list of properties from entity structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return partial entity object. List of entity object properties you can find here-Entities
parameter.name: select

parameter.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "offset" parameter. Default value is 50.
parameter.name: max

parameter.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "limit" parameter. Default value is 0.
parameter.name: offset

parameter.description: Entity objects property that should be used for sorting. Can be used in combination with the "order" parameter to have reverse order
parameter.name: sort

parameter.description: Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the "sort" parameter. Possible values: asc: results are shown in ascending order. desc: results are shown in descending order. Default sorting is asc. Example: order=desc
parameter.name: order

parameter.description: Comma-separated list of different options.Options[sendHidden, searchByOv, ovOnly, nonOvOnly] Example: options=searchByOv
parameter.name: options

parameter.description: Specifies maximum number of values listed in attributes. Example: defaultMaxValues=10
parameter.name: defaultMaxValues

field.name: EntityList

parameter.description: The access token permits the customer to request protected information by calling other Reltio APIs
parameter.name: accessToken

action.label: CreateEntity
action.name: CreateEntity
action.description: This will be used to create an entity in Reltio

parameter.name: Entity

field.name: CreateEntityResponse
field.xquery:
{let $entity_list := util:parseJSON($RESTResponse/*:payload/text()) let $EntityResponse:= for $item in $entity_list return <Entity> {$item/*} </Entity>
return <CreateEntityResponse> <ReltioId>{ fn:substring-after($EntityResponse[1]/object/uri, 'entities/') }</ReltioId> <Successful>{ if( exists($EntityResponse[1]/object/uri) ) then true() else false() }</Successful> </CreateEntityResponse>}

field.name: Errors

action.label: UpdateEntity
action.name: UpdateEntity
action.description: This action will be used to update Contact Preference and Multi Chanel Consent

field.name: UpdateEntityResponse
Errors

action.label: CustomerEntityPartialOverride
action.name: CustomerEntityPartialOverride
action.description: A partial override enables you to change parts in an entity or in a relationship. This option works only in the case of updating an entity. If this option is present, when only attributes that are provided in a request will be overwritten

field.name: UpdateEntityResponse
Errors

action.label: ExportEntities
action.name: ExportEntities
action.description:
The Export service provides API users with endpoints to export entities from Reltio Cloud. You can run an export operation for all entities or only the entities that match your export filter.
See https://docs.reltio.com/exportapi/exportentitieswithfilter.html

parameter.description:
Format of date and time attribute values (in CSV export only). Possible values: timestamp and readable.
Default value: timestamp.
parameter.name: dateFormat

parameter.description: Possible values: csv and json. Defines what output format would be used for export. Default is csv. Export to json is more efficient compared to export to csv.
parameter.name: fileFormat

parameter.description: If true, then export task is divided based on parts. Parts can be executed in parallel on different nodes. If not specified, one task is created.
parameter.name: distributed

parameter.description: The number of distributed task parts. If not specified, two tasks are created.
parameter.name: taskPartsCount

parameter.description: (Boolean flag, for CSV only). When true, collects CSV headers from ES.
parameter.name: useEsHeadersCollectionExport

parameter.description: Human readable part size. The service splits result files depending on this setting.
parameter.name: partSize

parameter.description: A name of the export task displayed in task status. The name is also used by the Export UI.
parameter.name: name

parameter.description:
This parameter accepts a list of entity fields to be exported. If not specified, then all fields are present in export.
Example: select=type,attributes.FirstName,attributes.Address.City
parameter.name: select

parameter.description: Enables object filtering by a condition. The format is the same as for filter in the EntitySearch request. However, there are some restrictions because in this case, the export service doesn't use ElasticSearch to filter objects.
parameter.name: filter

parameter.description:
This is comma-separated list of different options.
Available options:
searchByOV: disabled by default and used to search only by attributes with ov=true. parallelExecution: by default, all export jobs for the same tenant are executed one by one. In order to execute them in parallel you should add the parallelExecution option (an export job is either a single task or several distributed tasks).
parameter.name: options

parameter.description:
This parameter determines how the export service should process active and expired objects.
Possible values:
ALL: This option enables exporting of active and expired objects. ACTIVE: This option enables only exporting of active objects. This is the default value. NOT_ACTIVE: This option enables only exporting of expired objects.
parameter.name: activeness

parameter.description: This parameter provides the ability to export data from the S3 storage. Errors that may be returned are shown below.
parameter.name: dataSource

parameter.description:
This parameter can have two values: name or label. If label is the value, then for CSV column names, attribute labels are used. If nameis the value, then for CSV column names, attribute names are used.
Default value:name.
parameter.name: headerStyle

parameter.description: JSON object containing parameters for filtering exported entities.
parameter.name: exportFilter

parameter.description: Option To switch between Exploded and flat CSV output
parameter.name: exploded

action.label: GetTaskByID
action.name: GetTaskByID
action.description: Returns the task with the given ID or an error if there is no task with this ID.

parameter.description: Task ID
parameter.name: taskID

action.label: decryptExportUrl
action.name: decryptExportUrl
action.description: Decrypts Exported File Download URL. Response contains decrypted URL which can be used for download:

processObject.name: ExportFilter
processObject.description: Object Represents Export Filter Parameters as documented here https://docs.reltio.com/exportapi/exportentitieswithfilter.html

processObject.name: UpdateTimeFilter
processObject.description:
JSON object with update time range.
Format:
updateTimeFilter: {since : 1394726957000, to : 1394726959000}: either only one constraint or both of them are allowed.
